citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a developed and documented Exercise Plan for Dogs. This plan is important because it outlines
how the facility will provide for the opportunity for exercise of dogs while housed at the facility. The plan must account for
dogs housed individually or in groups, and the standard procedures to be followed in providing the opportunity for
exercise (frequency, method, and duration of exercise permitted). Correct by developing and documenting a written
exercise plan for dogs, approved by the Attending Veterinarian, and made available to APHIS officials upon request.
Correct by: October 1, 2023

The licensee is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) as prescribed. The PVC prescribes for the use of injectable
Ivermectin to be given orally to adult dogs once per month for the prevention of heartworm disease. Heartworm disease is
a parasitic infection spread by mosquitos. Affected dogs may be asymptomatic, or may have coughing, lethargy, or
exercise intolerance. Correct by ensuring that sampling and treatment of parasites, including heartworm disease, be
performed in accordance with a schedule and plan approved by the AV. Correct by: October 1, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
